top_categories.workout_context: Chequamegon MTB’s chequamegon national forest roads (60%), singletrack (40%) demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Chequamegon MTB isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Chequamegon MTB’s chequamegon national forest—mtb singletrack + forest roads and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Chequamegon MTB — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Chequamegon MTB — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on chequamegon national forest—mtb singletrack + forest roads.
Cadence efficiency makes every pedal stroke at Chequamegon MTB count — smooth technique reduces muscular fatigue over long distances.
Chequamegon MTB rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Chequamegon MTB when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Chequamegon MTB’s chequamegon national forest—mtb singletrack + forest roads drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
The varied gradients at Chequamegon MTB reward climbing adaptability — knowing when to sit, when to stand, and when to switch.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Chequamegon MTB. Make this intensity feel like home.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Chequamegon MTB’s chequamegon national forest—mtb singletrack + forest roads delivers on race day.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Chequamegon MTB’s 40 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Chequamegon MTB demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride chequamegon national forest—mtb singletrack + forest roads at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: chequamegon national forest roads (60%), singletrack (40%), technical mtb terrain. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 40 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and VO2max to prepare you for 40 miles of chequamegon national forest—mtb singletrack + forest roads in Cable, Wisconsin (Chequamegon National Forest).
